message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SY. 

The paper presents a method for semantic mapping using a robot equipped with a RGB-D sensor. The method involves detecting objects and localizing their 6 degree-of-freedom pose simultaneously. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Robotics (cs.RO) sub-category. Additionally, the method involves modeling the semantic mapping problem as a Conditional Random Field (CRF), which suggests that the paper may also belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The paper also proposes a particle filtering algorithm for inference in the CRF model, which suggests that the paper may belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. Finally, the paper involves using a robot to perform the semantic mapping task, which suggests that the paper may also belong to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category.
